title: Eric Dane Reveals He Missed the Emmys Due to Being Hospitalized
summary: Eric Dane reveals why he missed the 2025 Emmys when he was supposed to present an award alongside his "Grey's Anatomy" co-star Jesse Williams.
story: Eric Dane is sharing why he was noticeably absent from the 2025 Emmys.
The "Grey's Anatomy" star was expected to  present an award alongside his co-star Jesse Williams at the Sept. 14 ceremony but ultimately didn't appear on stage.
In an interview with The Washington Post that was published on Oct. 2, Dane revealed that he missed the awards show due to being hospitalized after experiencing a fall.
Dane, who announced his ALS diagnosis in April, said that shortly before the broadcast, he lost his balance and fell in the kitchen, causing him to get stitches.
“ALS is a nasty disease. … So I was in the hospital during the Emmys getting stitches put in my head,” he said.

“I missed an opportunity I was really looking forward to. It would have been great to see Jesse and get reunited with some of my peers, and to be able to present in front of my colleagues I thought would have a been special moment," he added. "So I was a really upset about it, but you know, there was nothing I could do about it.”
Dane took to Instagram on Sept. 15, one day after the Emmys, to say he's working with “I Am ALS“ on its Push for Progress initiative to find a cure for the disease.

“I’m Eric Dane. An actor, a father and now a person living with ALS,” he said in the video. “For over a century, ALS has been incurable, and we’re done accepting the status quo. We need the fastest path to a cure.”
In April, the "Euphoria" actor, who shares two kids with wife, Rebecca Gayheart, revealed he was diagnosed with ALS in an interview with People.
“I kindly ask that you give my family and I privacy during this time," he told the publication.
ALS is short for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and it's a "progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord," according to the ALS Association.

"The motor nerves affected when you have ALS are the motor neurons that provide voluntary movements and muscle control," per the ALS Association. As a result, the association explains that people may lose muscle control and the ability to “speak, eat, move and breathe” as the motor neurons degenerate.
Despite his ALS diagnosis, Dane said he still plans on acting for as long as he's able.
“I’m going to ride this till the wheels fall off,” he told E! News in June. “Keeps me sharp. It keeps me moving forward, which is super important right now.”

title: Kim Kardashian Channels Kris Jenner With Edgy Pixie Cut at Paris Fashion Week
summary: Kim Kardashian attended Paris Fashion Week with Kylie Jenner and showed off her new pixie cut hairstyle that fans say make her look like mom Kris Jenner.
story: Kris Jenner isn't the only member of her family who can rock a pixie cut.
In a Oct. 4 Instagram post, Kim Kardashian shared some photos of herself rocking a hairstyle that's reminiscent of the short hairdo  her mom, Kris Jenner, is known for.
"PARIS PIXIE," Kardashian captioned the snaps.
The first pic shows Kardashian looking at the camera head on, while the second pic shows her side profile.
In the comments, fans compared her to the family matriarch.
“Ok, calm down Kris Jenner,” one person wrote.
Another said, “Stunning 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥.”
A third added, “Totally thought this was Kris when I was scrolling through the feed. Love this 😍.”
The "Kardashians" star wore the look while attending Maison Margiela fashion show on Oct. 4 during Paris Fashion Week. Her sister, Kylie Jenner, was also in attendance.
For the event, Kardashian rocked a long grey trench coat and a pair of black boots with clear heels. Jenner, on the other hand, donned an all-white outfit with a pair of matching heels.
That same day, Kardashian was also seen wearing her pixie cut outside the Alaïa show, wearing a structured black corset top with a sheer skirt and black jacket.

Kardashian has changed up her hair a number of times in the past. In 2022, she debuted a beach blond look and also dyed her eyebrows the same color for a photo shoot in the September issue of Interview Magazine.
A few years prior, in 2020, she dyed her hair red and showed off her new look on social media.
“You guys, I dyed my hair red. Do you love it?” she said in a clip posted on X.
Kardashian isn't the only family member who has changed up her look from time to time. In 2024, Kylie Jenner got a pixie cut and Kourtney Kardashian recently trimmed her hair and got bangs.

title: Hilary Duff Shows Off Dance Moves in Surprise Appearance as Role Model's Sally
summary: Role Model invited Hilary Duff on stage to dance with him when he played his hit song “Sally, When the Wine Runs Out" on stage in Texas.
story: Hilary Duff is the latest celebrity to play "Sally" at Role Model's concert.

On her Instagram stories, Duff, 38, posted a video of her dancing on stage with Role Model when he was performing his hit song “Sally, When the Wine Runs Out" at the Austin City Limits Music Festival in Texas.
At one part in the performance, Duff gave Role Model a big hug before she was seen exiting the stage.

For the event, Duff wore a cropped black shirt and a mini skirt. On her Instagram stories, she also posted a photo of herself holding up an envelope that said "Sally" while she rode in a cart outside.
During her performance, also captured by fans, Role Model gave a special nod to Duff’s 2003 song, “What Dreams Are Made Of,” which was featured in the actor's The Lizzie McGuire Movie.
“This is what dreams are made of, baby” the 28-year-old singer yelled into the microphone as he and Duff danced together.
Since the 2024 release of his song, Role Model has made it a tradition to bring celebrities on stage with him when he sings “Sally, When the Wine Runs Out.”
Some other stars who have taken on the role of Sally are Natalie Portman, Kate Hudson, and TODAY's Al Roker.
The song tells the story of a "wild" girl named Sally who steals Role Model's heart. Throughout the song, he raves about her personality and secretly hopes she's not seeing anyone else.
In the chorus, he says, "Sally / That feeling’s coming around / Please don’t go falling in love / Then disappear when the wine runs out."

Duff's appearance on stage comes nearly two months after she teased her return to music. In September, she posted some photos of herself in a recording studio and captioned it, "new music … or something 🪩✨🍒."

That same month, Atlantic Records released a press release that said she signed a deal with them and will also be coming out with an “intimate docuseries” that will chronicle her return to music. Duff hasn't released an album since 2015’s “Breathe In. Breathe Out."

The docuseries will embrace “the ups, downs, and everything in between” and show Duff “as she balances raising a family, recording new music, live show rehearsals, and preparing to perform on stage for the first time in over a decade," the press release read.

title: 'Golden Bachelor' Gerry Turner Announces He's Getting Married 1 Year After Theresa Nist Divorce
summary: "Golden Bachelor" star Gerry Turner got engaged to his girlfriend, Lana Sutton. See pictures of her new engagement ring!
story: "Golden Bachelor" star Gerry Turner is ready to walk down the aisle again.
On Instagram, Turner announced that he and his girlfriend, Lana Sutton, are officially engaged. To share the news, he posted some photos of them together with her donning her new engagement ring.
In two of the photos, Turner is seen standing next to his fiancée on the beach while she places her hand on his chest to show off her new bling.
He captioned the snaps, "We’ve got BIG news. The Golden Bachelor is OFF the market. I found my perfect match and she said 'YES'. I Love this woman."
Turner's engagement comes 15 months after he filed for divorce from "Golden Bachelor" winner Theresa Nist in April 2024.

“Theresa and I have had a number of heart-to-heart conversations, and we’ve looked closely at our situation, our living situation, so forth and — and we’ve kind of come to the conclusion mutually that it’s probably time for us to — dissolve our marriage,” he said in an interview that aired on ABC in April 2024.

Though their relationship didn't work out, Turner has since found love again. In an April interview on the “Bachelor Happy Hour” podcast, the reality TV star, who revealed he’s been diagnosed with an incurable form of bone marrow cancer in December, said he was dating someone new.

“I am dating someone,” he teased of his new relationship with Sutton. “I think at this point it’s going well. But I don’t want to say too much and jinx it and I’m trying to respectfully get to a point where there’s an acceptable amount of time from my divorce.”

Turner explained that Nist knows he's been seeing someone and he's been doing his best to "slow roll" his relationship. He also said his kids, Jenny Young and Angie Warner, have already met his new girlfriend.

“I think the fun part there is she has daughters that I really relate to, and she relates well to my daughters,” he said. “So we’ve been around each other briefly. It’s been fun. It’s been a very enjoyable encounter.”

Since the reveal, Turner has posted many pictures of him and Sutton together on Instagram. In one post, there're seen vacationing in the UK, and in another they're seen going to Paris and London together.

"The past two months have been an absolute blast — travel, adventure, and quality time with two families. Feeling grateful to have met such a kind-hearted woman. What a partner!" Turner shared on Instagram in May.

title: What Chase Infiniti Said to Leonardo DiCaprio to Get Him to Do TikToks for 'One Battle After Another'
summary: “One Battle After Another” star Chase Infiniti explains how she was able to get her on screen co-stars, like Leonardo DiCaprio, to participate in TikTok trends.
story: “One Battle After Another” star Chase Infiniti admits it took a bit of arm twisting to get some of the cast, including her on-screen co-star Leonardo DiCaprio, to jump on the TikTok trend bandwagon to promote their latest film.

In the Paul Thomas Anderson action thriller, Infiniti plays Willa, the daughter of Bob (DiCaprio), a fatigued former revolutionary and over protective father. After Willa is kidnapped by her father’s former enemy, Col. Steven J. Lockjaw (Sean Penn) — who was also behind the disappearance of her mother, Perfidia Beverly Hills (Teyana Taylor) — she and Bob fight for their survival.

Leading up to the Sept. 26 release of the film, Infiniti enlisted her co-stars Regina Hall, Teyana Taylor, Benicio del Toro, Leo DiCaprio and Sean Penn for a series of social media promos that nodded to current internet trends.

She even tapped the film’s director Anderson for the “Oh, That’s Not Bad” trend, and managed to snag DiCaprio for a remix to the “Bob Girl Summer” trend, with the Oscar winner lipsyncing Nicki Minaj’s verse on the “B.o.B” song.

The film’s social media promos, which quickly went viral and amassed millions of views across platforms, were an immediate hit online with early support from the director, DiCaprio and the Warner Bros. marketing team, who helped to spearhead the campaign.

Speaking to TODAY.com about how it all came together, Infiniti explains that after being given the directive to “start making TikToks,” she says it took a bit of persuading to actually get her co-stars on board.

“I remember right when we were about to start the press tour, Paul and Leo were like, ‘Hey, we need you to get on Tiktok and you start making TikToks.’ And I was like, ‘OK, you guys are going to have to be in them too. I hope you’re ready for that,” she says. “And then I would literally just show up with different, like, trends or ideas that I would see and I would show an example.”
She continues, “I’d be like, ‘Do you like this? Yes or no?’ And then if they said ‘Yes,’ or if I could convince them, then we would get the Tiktok.”
So what did Infiniti actually say to “convince” her seemingly reluctant co-stars like DiCaprio, del Toro, Penn and even director Anderson to participate in these Gen Z-influenced trends?
Infiniti reveals a little begging and one magic word did the trick.

“I feel like all the convincing was … kind of like, ‘Please, can we please, do it? I promise it’s cool. I promise it’s fun,’” she says, before later sharing her personal plea to Sean Penn. “I was like, ‘Please, please be in the video, Sean, it would be so good.’”
The “One Battle After Another” breakout star says it did take some heavy maneuvering and hand-holding for her to get the TikTok trends just right.

“It was me being like, ‘Stand here. You’re going to say this,’ or, ‘You don’t have to say anything, but you’re going to stand here and move here.’ And it was kind of me just placing them where they needed to go,” she says.
Eventually, Infiniti explains, “the more that we did it, the more that they enjoyed them."
The real test of success was when she was given a thumbs up of approval by Anderson’s kids, whom he shares with actor Maya Rudolph.
“So I was like, ‘That’s how I know that I’m doing it right,’” she quipped.

Now, following the film’s release, the breakout star can easily break a smile as she reflects on her uncanny ability to turn Baby Boomers into certified TikTok stars. But, Infiniti shares, there is one specific promo that’s her pièce de résistance and lives in her head rent free.
“The one I was the most excited to get was the, ‘What’s your name? B.o.B. So they calling you Bob,’ with Leo. I was very happy to get that one,” she beams.

While the film’s promotional run has come to an end, “One Battle After Another” seems to keep the door open for more of the story. When asked if there could be a sequel following the dark comedy’s dramatic ending, Infiniti tells TODAY.com that she’s open to it and teases what she’d like to see.

“I think that if Willa and Perfidia ever had the chance to reunite, getting to witness that and to see how that would play out would be really interesting, because of the time spent apart, the things that have happened in between,” she says.
“I think that that feels like a wonderful close of the book, closing the chapter temporarily. I’m not sure what will happen in the future, but that’s why we’re hopeful,” she says.
As far as where the story may go for her character’s dad Bob, Infiniti jokes she hopes he finally gets the help he needs.

“I hope Bob does not stay as paranoid,” she says. “I think that my biggest hope for Bob is that he can actually, like, sit on the couch and chill. He doesn’t have to be as paranoid as he has been in the past.”
“One Battle After Another” is now in theaters nationwide.

title: Is ‘Saturday Night Live’ New Tonight, Oct. 4?
summary: “Saturday Night Live” is back! Season 51 kicks off with a premiere hosted by Bad Bunny.
story: “Saturday Night Live” is back!
Following an over four-month summer hiatus, the historic live comedy show is returning for Season 51, bringing a cast of beloved players and fresh faces to 30 Rockefeller Plaza.

After the previous season of “SNL” celebrated 50 years of laughs, creator Lorne Michaels vowed to “shake things up” around Studio 8H. Over the past several weeks, former cast members Ego Nwodim, Heidi Gardner, Michael Longfellow, Devon Walker and Emil Wakim revealed they will not be returning to the show. Meanwhile, new comics on the scene this season include Tommy Brennan, Jeremy Culhane, Kam Patterson and Veronika Slowikowska.
Is There a New Episode of ‘SNL’ on Tonight?
Yes, “SNL” Season 51 kicks off Saturday, Oct. 4, with host Bad Bunny and musical guest Doja Cat.

While Bad Bunny was the musical guest for the final episode of Season 50 in May, Saturday's show marks the “Debí Tirar Más Fotos” rapper's second time serving as host. His hosting debut in October 2023 during Season 49 led to several viral clips and characters.
A week before his sophomore hosting gig, Bad Bunny was announced as the headliner for the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show.
How to Watch ‘SNL’

The first episode of “SNL” Season 51 will air live on NBC at 11:30 p.m. ET. The show will also be available to stream the next day on Peacock. (Peacock and TODAY.com share a parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Who Is Hosting ‘SNL’ This Season?
Earlier this month, “SNL” revealed the show’s hosts and musical guests for the first three weeks of October.
Saturday, Oct. 4: host Bad Bunny with musical guest Doja Cat Saturday, Oct. 11: host Amy Poehler with musical guest Role Model Saturday, Oct. 18: host and music guest Sabrina Carpenter
Saturday, Oct. 4: host Bad Bunny with musical guest Doja Cat
Saturday, Oct. 11: host Amy Poehler with musical guest Role Model
Saturday, Oct. 18: host and music guest Sabrina Carpenter

title: Selena Gomez Reveals She Left Her Wedding 'A Little Earlier Than Most' in BTS Pics
summary: Selena Gomez continues to share behind-the-scenes looks from her and Benny Blanco's wedding day
story: Selena Gomez continues to share behind-the-scenes looks from her and Benny Blanco's wedding day.
The "Only Murders in the Building" star and her music producer husband got married on Sept. 27, 2025. She confirmed the news on her Instagram, sharing photos and video from her special day.
On Oct. 3, Gomez posted a handful of photos that appear to be taken before she walked down the aisle up until she left her reception earlier than expected.
“From writing my vows to leaving my wedding a little earlier than most..,” Gomez captioned the Instagram slideshow.

Photos included in her post show Gomez in a navy blue robe with roses, wearing sparkly cat-eye sunglasses with a veil. She's also seen in silky pink pajamas seemingly writing her vows. There's also a photo of her and Blanco arm-in-arm and walking on the beach, as well as white chocolate covered strawberries decorated as a bride and groom, among other pics.
The final snap in the bunch shows Gomez in a white dress and flats, seemingly leaving her reception early.
The couple, who announced their engagement in December 2024, have been sharing snippets from their nuptials in recent days.
Shortly after they said “I do,” Blanco posted his own photos of the two, captioning the Instagram post, “I married a real life disney princess.”
Gomez commented, “I love you soooo much,” with a white heart.

The “Same Old Love” singer wore three wedding dresses for her wedding festivities, all designed by Ralph Lauren. According to the designer, her satin gown with the halter neckline, embroidery and 3D florals was “for the wedding.”
Her second gown was made out of “300 hand-shaped and applied lace flowers” and included the couple's initials and wedding date sewn into the design.
Her third, seen above in her most recent BTS slideshow, was a shorter look with a voluminous underskirt.
The newlyweds haven't been shy about sharing photos from their wedding day. Among their pics include a look at their new bands.
To accompany Gomez's marquise diamond engagement ring, she paired it with a larger diamond wedding band. Blanco, on his end, opted for a gold ring.

Additionally, Gomez has also shared a breakdown and look at her wedding day makeup. She even created a “wedding kit” bundle that included the products she used from her Rare Beauty company to share with her fans.

title: 'Gilmore Girls' Stars Reunite to Celebrate Lauren Graham at Her Walk of Fame Ceremony
summary: Lauren Graham’s former “Gilmore Girls” co-stars showed up to cheer her on at her Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony in Los Angeles on Oct.
story: Lauren Graham’s former “Gilmore Girls” co-stars showed up to cheer her on at her Hollywood Walk of Fame ceremony in Los Angeles on Oct. 3.

In a scene right out of Stars Hollow, Graham reunited with castmates Scott Patterson, Kelly Bishop, Matt Czuchry and Yanic Truesdale. Sam Pancake, who appeared in the hit show's 2016 revival “Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life,” acted as the star-studded ceremony's emcee.
Graham, who played witty single mom Lorelai Gilmore on the show, said she was “proud” of the work she’d done and felt “lucky to have gotten to work with some incredible writers and showrunners.”

While at the podium, Graham jokingly noted that only one of the three actors who portrayed the hotly-debated love interests of her TV daughter Rory, played by Alexis Bledel, had shown up to the ceremony.
“Czuchry is here. (Milo) Ventimiglia, no. (Jared) Padalecki,” she observed before quipping, “Points for Logan. Um, just points. Just points. It’s an ongoing system... It isn’t done yet.”
She also thanked “Gilmore Girls” fans for being so “kind” and “enthusiastic.”

“I’m so moved when you come up to me in — usually at the airport bathroom,” she said to laughter, “and tell me how much the show has meant to you and that you’ve shared it with a family member and maybe passed it on to another generation.”
Graham also saluted “Gilmore Girls’ co-creator Amy Sherman-Palladino, saying, “Sometimes I feel we share a brain and kind of have a relationship where I hear what she intends when she writes.”
She called being able to say the dialogue in Sherman-Palladino’s scripts “an incredible gift.”
Sherman-Palladino also spoke at the ceremony, recalling that she worried the role of Lorelai was “uncastable” before she met Graham and knew immediately, “It’s her.”
She praised Graham’s talent as an actor, calling her “this wonderful woman who’s given me my career.”
Bledel did not attend the ceremony, though she and Graham reunited last month to present an award at the 2025 Emmy Awards.

Patterson, who played Lorelai's friend and eventual love interest, coffee shop owner Luke Danes, shared a video from the ceremony on Instagram, writing, "Congratulations to Lauren Graham on your Hollywood Walk of Fame Star! I’m so proud of you!"

title: Would Robert Irwin Ever Be On 'The Bachelor'? What He Said
summary: Robert Irwin weighs in on the idea of looking for love on "The Bachelor."
story: Robert Irwin has gained a legion of devoted fans since making his debut on "Dancing With the Stars" last month, and some of them are rallying for him to be the next star of "The Bachelor."

The 21-year-old wildlife conservationist, who heated up the "DWTS" dance floor by ripping off his shirt during his salsa with pro partner Witney Carson on the Sept. 29 episode, says the idea of him joining the ABC reality dating series is not out of the question.
"Hey, I mean, never say never," Irwin told "Entertainment Tonight" after hearing the pitch.
Irwin then repeated, "Never say never," while placing his chin on his fist and grinning.
"I mean, I'm looking for the perfect person so stranger things have happened," added Irwin, whose dad is the late famed conservationist and TV personality Steve Irwin.
The woman of Irwin's dreams he said, doesn't necessarily need to be comfortable right away with snakes and other wildlife he regularly handles.

"You know, I think we can get over that. I think she's got to like animals but even if (she's) a little bit afraid of the snakes and spiders, that's fine," he said, waving his hand in the air. "I'm pretty good at slowly but surely kind of convincing pretty much everyone to like animals."
As for what he looks for in a partner, the native Australian said he’d love to meet someone whose views align with his, but who has new perspectives to offer, too.
“You got to take, you know, everything you’ve learned as a lesson and find someone that your core values, I think, come together. But I think it’s important to have someone different,” he explained.
Irwin recently told E! News he’s interested in meeting an “American girl.”

When it comes to qualities he finds attractive, Irwin said, “I think more than anything else, just genuine kindness and that’s so important. I think you need to surround yourself with people who are genuinely kind.”

Irwin added that his life is “a whirlwind,” and whoever he dates needs to be able to keep up with his busy schedule. “It’s an adventure and I would love to be able to share that with someone and to share those little moments,” he said.

“I have a lot of great role models in the love department and a lot of people I look up to and go, wow you guys are couples goals,” he added. “So I want to find that, but it’s something you kind of can’t rush. It just has to happen and you got to be open to that. I know she’s out there and I look forward to it.”

title: Did Ed Gein Really Kill His Brother? What 'Monster' Shows and What Happened
summary: Did Ed Gein kill his brother Henry? Here's what really happened and if Ed ever confessed to killing his older brother.
story: Ed Gein admitted to killing two women. But did he kill his older brother, Henry, as well? The latest season of "Monster" imagines he did, although the facts are less clear.
"Monster" looks into the making of a killer whose gruesome crimes and family backstory would go on to inspire horror films like "Psycho" and "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre."
Charlie Hunnam stars as Ed Gein, who was nicknamed the "Butcher of Plainfield" for the house of horrors found in his Plainfield, Wisconsin home.
Here's what to know about Henry and Ed Gein.
Who were Henry and Ed Gein?
Henry and Ed Gein were the two children born to Augusta and George Gein in Wisconsin in the early 1900s — Henry in 1902 and Ed in 1906.
The Gein biography "Deviant," written by the true crime writer Harold Schechter, describes Augusta as a "domestic tyrant" and a woman of strict religious conviction, bordering on "madness."
RELATED: Who Was Ed Gein’s Mother, Augusta? All About the Woman Who Raised a ‘Monster’

The boys grew up on a remote farm, six miles outside of Plainfield, per the book. There, she handled her sons' "religious and moral training." She emphasized, to her sons, the "wickedness of modern women."
What Happened Between Ed and Henry Gein?
Schechter wrote that the boys had a "good relationship," but disagreed on one thing: their mom.
Henry Gein once confronted Ed Gein about their mother, raising “some serious questions about her hold over her younger son.”
Ed Gein, in response, was “astonished” to learn his brother didn’t also regard their mother as a “saint on earth.”
“Henry’s implied criticism of Augusta came as a real shock to Eddie,” Schechter wrote.

This conversation is seemingly depicted in “Monster.” Standing with Ed in a barn, Henry lays out his plan to leave the family, find freedom from their controlling mother and marry the woman he loves, of whom Augusta disapproves

“I can’t do the religion no more. The cage she built for herself, Ed. She’s trapped in it. Look at me. Right in the eye. You’re gonna get trapped in it, too. Listen to me. I’m getting out of here. I’m leaving you. Do you understand?” Henry says.
He also urges Ed to leave Augusta's grip, too, saying, "You need to get out of here too. Mother is sick. She’s a sick woman.”
He also seems to pick up on the route Ed is going down, saying, "You’ve always been a peculiar type. Mother’s making you very strange. I hate to see you like that.”
Ed, meanwhile, is resistant to anyone going against his mom. "I don't want to hear that. Don't talk like that about her," he says.
Did Ed Gein Really Kill His Brother?

In the show, Ed fatally strikes his brother with a log after the conversation. Ed then imagines him standing up and saying he changed his mind about Augusta – but in actuality, he's dead. Ed later drags Henry's frozen body out into a marsh and starts a fire.

Schechter, in "Deviant," wrote about the mystery of Henry Gein's death at the age of 43. The "single indisputable fact" about Henry Gein's death was that it happened May 16, 1944. The rest? Up to debate.

It did happen after the brothers were taking care of a fire on marshland near their home, Schechter wrote. Ed Gein later said that when the fire got out of control, he was separated from his brother. Later, he led a search to find Henry Gein — and led investigators right to the spot where his brother lay.

"Several odd things immediately struck the searchers. First, though the corpse was stretched out on a scorched piece of ground, there were no signs that Henry had been injured by the flames. His clothes were soot-covered but otherwise undamaged, and the exposed part of his body was similarly free of burns," Schechter wrote.
They also notice that Ed Gein's story didn't align: Before, he couldn't find his brother, but he led searchers directly there.
Henry Gein's cause of death was determined to be asphyxiation and the coroner decided a further inquest was not necessary.
Their mother died the following year.
Ed Gein never confessed to killing his brother but, in 1957, did confess to murdering two women: Beatrice Worden, a local hardware store owner, and Mary Hogan, a tavern operator.

title: The 'Law & Order' 'Dun Dun Diner' Serves Up an Epic Fan Experience: What's Inside
summary: A "Law & Order"-themed diner is open in New York City from Oct. 3-5, and features images of Mariska Hargitay, Chris Meloni and other cast members.
story: Longtime viewers of the "Law & Order" franchise know a diner is an integral part of the history: a safe haven for the detectives to grab a bite between cases or question potential witnesses of a crime.
And now, fans can visit the "Dun Dun Diner," a special pop-up celebrating 25 years of the mothership series. Don't worry, "SVU" lovers, there are nods to Olivia Benson and Elliot Stabler, as well.

The attraction, from NBC and Peacock in collaboration with NVE Experience Agency, will run from Friday, Oct. 3, to Sunday, Oct. 5, at New York City's Rockefeller Center. Reservations were free and available to the public on a first-come, first-served basis. While reservations are sold out, the retro diner set is visible to all from the outside and makes for a cool photo-op.
Read on to learn about what to expect from the "Dun Dun Diner."
Entering the 'Dun Dun Diner'
Within seconds of walking into the diner, a charismatic host greets patrons and presents a menu with food and merchandise options.

"Dun Dun Diner has been proudly serving Dedicated Detectives since 1990," the menu reads, along with a list of clever food options like Fin's French Toast, Partner Parfait and coffee "from our friends at Benson & Co."

That message mirrors one on a wall behind two suits worn by two of the franchise's most famous actors: Jerry Orbach, who played Detective Lennie Briscoe, and Jesse L. Martin, who played Briscoe's partner Detective Ed Green.

Then attendees line up for a photo at a red diner booth with a backdrop decorated in honor of Mariska Hargitay's Capt. Olivia Benson. A neon "What Would Olivia Benson Do?" sign flashes proudly in the middle of photos of her iconic character and a green sign from Olivia Benson Plaza, which was a similar "L&O" fan experience at 30 Rock.
After snapping three photos, fans place food and coffee orders at the counter before surveying some merch.
'Dun Dun Diner' Merchandise
The limited-edition merchandise is on display in a case similar to one used for dessert spreads in a diner.
Some free swag is included in the visit, and dinergoers can choose from one of three hats to get in a reusable "Elite Squad"-branded to-go bag. A keepsake diner mug is also included.
A half-zip sweatshirt and T-shirt/sock bundle from Dinner Service NY are also for sale at another counter.

For those undecided detectives, there's a QR code available to scan to order the items online. Additionally, a dark T-shirt with Olivia Benson and the words "Still New York's Finest" is available for preorder through another QR code and also on the NBCUniversal Shop's website.
Taking a Seat at the 'Dun Dun Diner'

A hostess helps seat patrons after they grab a copy of the Law & Order Ledger to read at a table, which is decked out with interactive place mats. The mats are filled with trivia questions, word scrambles and one of Benson's recent diner-related quotes to Stabler: "Detective, you feeling hangry?"
The walls of the dining room are also covered in "Law & Order" photos of past and present cast members and famous guest stars, like Jeremy Allen White, Ludacris and Serena Williams.
Another area features a snuggled-up snap of Benson and Stabler next to a plate with a Season 1 Stabler quote, "I'm your partner for better or worse."
After indulging in coffee and food, guests get a check with a message signed by "L&O" creator Dick Wolf.
No trip to the diner is complete without a sweet treat! Fans receive a free cookie from Milk Bar on their way out the door.

title: What Happened to Ed Gein? What 'Monster' Doesn't Show
summary: What happened to Ed Gein? How did he die? Here's what the show depicts and what actually happened to Ed Gein.
story: Ed Gein, the notorious killer who inspired legendary horror films from "Psycho" to "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre," is getting renewed attention from a new Netflix series.
Charlie Hunnam, known for his roles in "Sons of Anarchy" and "Pacific Rim," is portraying the killer in "Monster: The Ed Gein Story," which premiered on Oct. 3.
Hunnam spoke about visiting Gein's grave site after he finished filming the series in an interview on TODAY on Sept. 30.

"I thought it would be good, sort of a good conclusion, to go visit his grave and say what I wanted to say to him — basically that I hope that we had told his story honestly, at the very least, and and didn't invite him to come on the journey with me moving forward," Hunnam said. "I was ready to say goodbye to him and and that be the end."

Gein died in a psychiatric hospital at age 77 in 1984, and was buried in Plainfield, Wisconsin, where his house of horrors was discovered in 1957. His gravestone was later stolen in 2000 and never replaced.
Here's what to know about Gein's life after authorities discovered his house of horrors in 1957.
When Was Ed Gein Arrested?

Gein was arrested in 1957 after he was suspected of killing Bernice Worden, a local hardware store owner. When authorities went to Gein's home to question him, no one answered the door, but investigators saw the body of a woman hanging by the heels, according to the Associated Press.

Once they went inside, detectives identified the woman as Worden and found several severed body parts, a lampshade and furniture made from human skin and other horrifying items, according to the Associated Press.
In interviews with investigators, Gein admitted to killing two people, according to a transcript of the interviews included in the book, "The Ed Gein File" compiled by John Borowski.
After his arrest, Gein was declared unfit to stand trial and was sent to Central State Hospital at Waupun, the AP reported.

More than a decade after the discovery of Worden’s body, Gein faced trial and a judge found him guilty of murder in 1968. The same judge later ruled Gein was insane at the time of the crime and sent him back to Central State Hospital, according to the AP.
While at Central State Hospital, Gein worked as a carpenter, mason and hospital attendant, according to the AP.
In 1974, Gein sought freedom in a sanity hearing, but the judge sent him back to the hospital, according to the AP.
Authorities testified during the hearing that Gein was never a problem at the hospital, though he could react poorly to other people at the facility, the AP reported.
How Did Ed Gein Die?
In 1978, Gein was transferred to the Mendota Mental Health Institute, where he would remain until his death in 1984.

Gein died at age 77 of respiratory failure while at the institute, according to a 1984 report from United Press International. Officials at the institute said Gein also had been diagnosed with cancer before his death, according to UPI.

After Gein's death, the killer went on to inspire generations of Hollywood filmmakers, from Alfred Hitchcock's 1960 film "Psycho," to Tobe Hooper's "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" in 1974 and Jonathan Demme's "Silence of the Lambs" in 1991.
What Happens in 'Monster'?
Ed Gein's death is depicted in a fantastical sequence in "Monster."
Sitting across from a TV in the institute, Ed seems to go into a vision state. The nurses around him dance to "Owner of a Lonely Heart" by Yes as his wheelchair moves down a hallway.
Then, he sees the apparition of his mother, Augusta (played by Laurie Metcalf), at the top of the stairs. He walks up to meet her.
"You finally came," he says.
"Oh, of course I did. I thought you'd be happy," she says.
She tells Ed he "made something of himself" with the movies inspired by him. "In the end, you actually accomplished something," she says.
"The only one I ever wanted to impress was you," he says.
After Augusta says she "couldn't be more proud," Ed says he thinks it's time. The camera then finds Ed in bed taking his last breaths.

title: 'Real Housewives of Miami’ Star Drops Bombshell Story That Even Shocks Andy Cohen at Reunion
summary: Julia Lemigova revealed in Part 1 of "The Real Housewives of Miami" Season 7 reunion that she and Adriana de Moura slept together, to the surprise of Andy Cohen.
story: The "Real Housewives of Miami" Season 7 reunion turned awkward when one Bravo star spilled some major tea.
In the final moments of Part 1 of the reunion, host Andy Cohen asked Adriana de Moura about her rocky friendship with Julia Lemigova.
"It seems like Marysol (Patton) and Alexia's (Nepola) friendship with Julia was the catalyst for the division in your friendship. Would you think that that's fair?" he asked.
At this point, Julia interjected, saying, "Andy, can I say something just to give some clarity?"
Adriana jumped in and said, "He's asking me a question. Let me answer."
Andy reassured Julia that she would get her chance to speak after Adriana, who then gave her response.

"I feel like when she started to be friends with Alexia, I was fine with it. And Alexia wasn't instigating Julia. But then when Marysol got in the picture, Julia transformed herself, and she took a dive on the dark side. And I couldn't even recognize her anymore," Adriana said.
"So I'm like yes, there is something underneath that," she added.
Marysol chimed in saying, "You love to blame me for everything. Take responsibility for your own behavior."
Adriana also implied Marysol "enabled" Julia "to bring her true self out."
Julia then had the floor to share her perspective, and she didn't waste the opportunity.
“I would like to say something that will bring clarity, hopefully, on why we are with Adriana where we are,” she began.
Julia, who has been married to tennis legend Martina Navratilova for 10 years, then dropped some major news.
“In the Hamptons, Adriana and I slept together," she said.
Julia did not say when the moment in the Hamptons occurred, but the cast took a trip there in Season 4.
Andy and some of the other cast members were clearly taken aback by the revelation, and their facial expressions showed it.
Unfortunately for viewers, the episode ended there, leaving fans waiting for a resolution in Part 2 of the reunion, which will air Oct. 9 at 9 p.m. ET on Bravo.
In the preview for Part 2, Andy asks Julia if she has an open relationship with Martina.
"Our marriage was not great," Julia says.
A visibly upset Adriana walks off the set, and the promo jumps to another scene of Julia telling Andy: "We slept together once, and then we fooled around in the Versace Mansion."
The cast also seems divided about if Julia is making up the story or not.
Backstage, Adriana tells Julia she goes around "trying to seduce everybody."

Before the reunion even aired, Andy hinted that it would feature some shocking moments. During an episode of "Watch What Happens Live" that aired Sept. 11, he and guest Alexia spoke about the experience of filming the reunion.
“There was, I would call it, a huge bombshell dropped,” Andy said. “Wouldn’t you?”
“I think so, too. We, like, both fell out of our chair,” Alexia said.
“I mean, actually, actually, yes,” Andy replied. “Something huge.”

title: How to Watch Taylor Swift on ‘The Graham Norton Show’
summary: When is Taylor Swift on the British talk show "The Graham Norton Show"? Here is when it's airing and how to watch in the U.S.
story: Taylor Swift has visited with an old favorite to chat about her new album.
The pop superstar taped an interview with British talk show host Graham Norton in which they discussed her 12th studio album, "The Life of a Showgirl," which was released after midnight on Oct. 3.
She taped her appearance on Oct. 2 ahead of the album release.
Here's what to know about the interview.
How Can You Watch Taylor Swift's Interview on 'The Graham Norton Show'?
Swift's interview will air in the United Kingdom on Oct. 3 at 10:40 p.m. local time.
American Swifties will have to wait, as it will air on BBC America on Oct. 9 at 11 p.m. ET.
Is There a Glimpse at Swift's Appearance on the Show?
Photos released from the interview showed her bejeweled in a black dress with her engagement ring from fiancé Travis Kelce on her left ring finger.

Swift is part of a star-studded lineup on the show that also includes Oscar winner and "Oppenheimer" star Cillian Murphy, actors Jodie Turner-Smith, Greta Lee and Domhnall Gleeson, and Scottish singer Lewis Capaldi.
Is This Swift's First Interview on 'The Graham Norton Show'?
Swift has appeared multiple times on the popular British talk show over the years.
Ahead of her latest interview, the show released 45 minutes of highlights on YouTube from all of her previous interviews with Norton.

title: Which Songs from 'The Life of a Showgirl' Are About Travis Kelce – and What Do They Say?
summary: Which songs from The Life of a Showgirl are about Travis Kelce?
story: Taylor Swift's 12th studio album "The Life of a Showgirl" is out — and it's full of songs seemingly inspired by Taylor Swift's fiancé, Travis Kelce.
The singer first announced the new album while appearing on Kelce's podcast, "New Heights," in August. Since then, the Kansas City Chiefs star has been his fiancée's biggest hype man.
“I’ve been fortunate enough to hear every single song on here. So I know they’re all 12 bangers,” he said during a recent episode of the podcast.
Kelce also said he keeps listening to the album and has been "dancing all throughout the house."
“I know she mentioned that it’s gonna be a lot more pop beats and everything, but it’s just, it’s still so poetic, and how she (executes) her melodies and her references and stuff,” he said.
The adoration is clearly mutual since Swift included numerous nods to her better half in the lyrics of her new album. Below, we're decoding all the references.
'Opalite'
During a recent episode of his "New Heights" podcast, Kelce revealed that he was loving one particular song from the album.
“I think ‘Opalite’ might be my favorite, though, at least right now. Every time it comes on, I always catch myself,” he said.

Swift's fans started theorizing about the song and wondering if it was a nod to Kelce since opal is one of his birthstones. Although opal and opalite are slightly different, the theory turned out to be true.
During an interview on Capital FM on Oct. 3, Swift confirmed that "Opalite" is Kelce's favorite song off the new album and explained how his birthstone inspired the track.

"I have favorite words, favorite phrases, things that I’ll put in an endless file of lyrics that I’m just constantly going to go and cherry pick from when I’m writing. And I had written down the word opalite because I learned that it’s actually a man-made opal. Opal can be man-made just like diamonds," she said.
The singer went on to note that opal is Travis' birthstone and she's always "loved that stone."

"I thought it was a kind of a cool metaphor that it’s a man-made opal and happiness can also be man-made too. So that’s kind of what the song is about: the kind of juxtaposition of those two," she said.
'Wood'
"Wood" is the shortest song on "The Life of a Showgirl," but it's still chock-full of meaning. The track is about being unlucky in love then finding the one she needs.
Fans are picking up on the song's seeming double entendres, as well as the reference to Kelce's "New Heights" podcast.

"Baby, I’ll admit I’ve been a little superstitious/ The curse on me was broken by your magic wand/ Seems to me that you and me, we make our own luck/ New heights of manhood/ I ain’t gotta knock on wood," she sings.
"The Fate of Ophelia"
In "The Fate of Ophelia," Swift rewrites the story of Ophelia, one of many doomed characters in William Shakespeare's "Hamlet."
In the song, Swift seems to reference Kelce's bold romantic gesture when he tried to meet her at her "Eras Tour" and give her a friendship bracelet with his number on it.
“I heard you calling/ On the megaphone/ You wanna see me all alone,” she sings.
Swift also appears to credit Kelce with saving her from the fate of Ophelia as she sings, "And if you’d never come for me/ I might’ve drowned in the melancholy."
During an interview with iHeart, she explained, “The hook is like, someone comes into your life and rescues you from the fate of being driven mad by love.”
Swift seems to shout out Kelce's Kansas City Chiefs as she sings, "Pledge allegiance to your hands, your team, your vibes."
'Wi$h Li$t'
Swift is clearly lucky in love with Kelce and she appears to sing all about her dreams for their future in “Wi$h Li$t.”
"I just want you/ Have a couple kids, got the whole block looking like you/ We tell the world to leave us the f--- alone, and they do," she sings.
Later in the song, Swift appears to sing about how she dreamed of finding someone like Kelce.

"I made wishes on all of the stars/ Please, God bring me a best friend who I think is hot/ I thought I had it right once, twice, but I did not/ You caught me off my guard/ I hope I get what I want/ Cause I know what I want/ I just want you," she sings.
While appearing on iHeart Radio, Swift said this particular song is a “very accurate stance on where I’m at in life.”
'Eldest Daughter'
Swift, who is an eldest daughter herself, sings about many topics, including marriage, in her song "Eldest Daughter."
She even references a youngest child, presumably Kelce. He's the youngest of two boys (and brother Jason Kelce is also an NFL pro).

“When I said I don’t believe in marriage, that was a lie/ Every eldest daughter was the first lamb to the slaughter/ So we all dressed up as wolves and we looked fire/ But I’m not a bad b---/ And this isn’t savage/ But I’m never gonna let you down/ I’m never gonna leave you out,” she sings.
Swift goes on to say she once made fun of things like “Ferris wheels, kisses and lilac,” sing, “Cause I thought that I’d never find that."
'Honey'
During the love song "Honey," Swift sings about her past experiences with pet names.

"When anyone called me sweetheart, it was passive aggressive at the bar/ And the b---- was telling me to back off/ Cause her man had looked at me wrong/ If anyone called me honey it was standing in the bathroom, white teeth/ They were saying that skirt don’t fit me and I cried the whole way home," she sings.
Swift then transitions to her present situation, where pet names have a positive connotation.

"But you touch my face redefine all of those blues/ When you say/ You can call me honey if you want because I’m the one you want/ I’m the one you want/ You give it different meaning/ Cause you mean it when you talk," she sings.
'Elizabeth Taylor'

Elizabeth Taylor, who was married seven times, knew a thing or two about high-profile relationships. In this song named after the late actor, Swift sings, "Elizabeth Taylor, do you think it’s forever?" as she talks about a relationship.
She goes on to describe how this particular romance is different from her past ones, singing, "All the right guys/ Promised they’d stay/ Under bright lights/ They withered away/ But you bloom."
In the song, Swift talks about a man who worships her while others criticize her. She also expresses her fears of losing their love.
"They say I’m bad news/ I just say thanks/ And you look at me like you’re hypnotized/ And I think you know why/ And if you ever leave me high and dry/I’d cry my eyes violet," she sings.

title: Who Is the New Guy on Olivia Benson's Squad on 'Law & Order: SVU'? What to Know
summary: Who is the new guy on "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit"? The NBC show introduced Detective Jake Griffin (Corey Cott), who's friendly with Chief Kathryn Tynan.
story: Warning: This article contains spoilers for Episode 2 of Season 27 of "Law & Order: SVU."
Jake Griffin is a new detective on the squad in "Law & Order: SVU," but which side is he working for?
The second episode of Season 27, which aired Oct. 2, introduces Griffin, played by Corey Cott, as he gets off to a turbulent start under the command of Mariska Hargitay's Capt. Olivia Benson.
Cott previously appeared on the show in Season 18 as a perpetrator named Ellis Griffin.
Here's what to know about the new character.
Detective Jake Griffin Has Friends in High Places

The episode reveals that Jake Griffin's late father is a former partner of Benson's new boss, Chief Kathryn Tynan, played by Noma Dumezweni. Griffin tells Benson that Tynan took him "under her wing" following his father’s death.

He immediately raises the concern to Benson that she might think he's "some sort of spy" for Tynan due to his connection to the chief. He insists he's just working under Benson to "learn how to become a good detective."
While Benson gives him the benefit of the doubt, some other members of the "SVU" squad are not so certain.
"He's got some powerful friends, so watch yourself," Capt. Renee Curry (Aimé Donna Kelly) warns her colleagues.
Griffin's Nickname Is 'Batman' on the Street
While he goes by "Griff" among his fellow officers, Griffin became known by another name during his time working as a cop on the street.
"I heard about this guy, they call him Batman," Detective Terry Bruno (Kevin Kane) tells the rest of the squad.
"It’s a stupid nickname the mopes in Times Square used to call me," Griffin insists.
An informant also refers to Griffin's nickname later in the episode.
"Oh, Griffy, Griff, Griff," he says. "Streets have been talking. They say you hung up your Batman wings?"
Griffin, in front of Bruno, tells the informant to be quiet.
Griffin Immediately Gets on Benson's Nerves
Besides the nepotism connections, Griffin irks Benson with some of his investigation tactics.

After they visit a woman in the hospital who was drugged at a club, he declines to tell Benson at first about a tattoo on the victim's wrist that provides a clue to the case. He also initially blocks the distraught victim from leaving the hospital room.
"This is what I was talking about when I said we work as one team," an exasperated Benson later says to him about failing to tell her about the tattoo.
Griffin also has his co-workers rolling their eyes after he raises his hand to speak in squad meetings.
"Dude, if you raise your hand one more time, I'm going to shoot it off," Bruno says.
Griffin later disobeys Benson's orders for the squad to go home and doubles back to an illicit sex club they are trying to infiltrate. Benson labels him "a cowboy who makes decisions on his own."
She says she's going to call the chief and tell her about his behavior, and Griffin is able to dissuade her after explaining a break he got them in the case.
Griffin Might Actually Be a Spy for the Chief?
After he finds an employee in the club who helps crack the case, Griffin apologizes to Benson for going into the club on his own.
He promises never to go behind her back again.

However, the ending of the episode that aired on NBC differed from what's shown now streaming on Peacock. At the end of the Peacock version, Griffin walks up to a brownstone, where he greets a man named John sitting in a truck outside.
"Good to see you," Griffin tells him.
"Chief Tynan's inside waiting for you," John says.
Griffin thanks John and walks up the steps to the brownstone.
The ominous ending seems to imply that Griffin really is a mole for the chief inside "SVU," but it's not made clear.

title: Courteney Cox Hosts a Weekly Sunday Night Dinner. Who's on the Guest List?
summary: Courteney Cox told TODAY about her weekly Sunday night dinner and who is on the guest list including past guests Elton John and Taylor Swift.
story: Like her “Friends” character, Monica Geller, Courteney Cox enjoys inviting loved ones over to her immaculately clean home in Los Angeles for good food and fun times.

In fact, the actor and Homecourt founder is still hosting the same weekly Sunday night dinner party she began years ago, she told TODAY style correspondent Zanna Roberts Rassi in an interview that aired Oct. 3.

"My grandmother used to have Sunday gatherings ... and I’m the youngest of 21 first cousins. So when I moved to LA, there wasn’t really a community, because everyone lives so far. So I started doing my own Sundays," said Cox.
As you can imagine, Cox's invitees over the years have included plenty of A-listers and even a few "dream guests."
"I mean, look, I had Elton John there and I played the piano with him. So that would have been a dream. I mean, Stevie Wonder," Cox recalled.

It was Cox's close friend Ed Sheeran who brought Sir Elton to her home. Musical magic happened when Cox, Sheeran and singer-songwriter Brandi Carlile joined John for a cover of his 1972 hit "Tiny Dancer," featuring Cox on the piano.

The quartet hilariously opted to sing the mistaken lyrics Phoebe Buffet, played by Lisa Kudrow, once sang on "Friends," which meant changing the phrase "Hold me closer, tiny dancer” to “Hold me closer, Tony Danza."
How did Cox and Sheeran persuade Sir Elton to agree to sing such a silly version of his song?

"I’ve known Ed for about, like, 13 years. I knew Brandi because we did a video together. And Ed said, 'I’m going to have Elton over for dinner, if that’s OK with you,'" Cox recalled. "And he said, 'Why don’t you play one of the songs? We could do 'Hold Me Closer.' But he calls it 'Tony Danza,' because that’s the Lisa Kudrow version, the Phoebe version.

"So I quickly called my piano teacher and said, 'You’ve got to come over and teach me 'Tiny Dancer,'" Cox continued, adding "The reason why I stopped the video when I did is because that’s all I had learned. That was it."
Cox called performing the song with John "one of the greatest moments" of her life.
Sheeran brought a different kind of magic into Cox's life when he showed up to her place one night with members of the Irish rock band Snow Patrol.
Despite the fact that Taylor Swift was also at her home that night, Cox right away noticed the band's guitarist Johnny McDaid, who would later become her boyfriend.
"I remember seeing (McDaid), and I thought, 'Oh, he’s a really handsome guy.' But we didn’t have this moment at all. And then later on he asked me out," she shared.
Cox may have channeled Monica Geller's love of a beautiful living space when she launched Homecourt, her line of luxury home and beauty care products.
"I was thinking, God, we’re home all the time. The most important thing to us is where we live. We take care of our skin, our hair. So why not care about your home in the same way?" she said.
Cox, who said she's "involved in every part" of Homecourt, told Rassi she's excited about the company's new Cece Body Collection, which was inspired by her signature scent.
"It's cardamom and cedar wood and cinnamon," said Cox. "It's smoky and sexy."

title: Taylor Swift References a Shakespearean Figure in ‘The Fate of Ophelia’: Lyrics, Explained
summary: What is "The Fate of Ophelia" about? Unpacking the lyrics to Taylor Swift's opening track of "The Life of a Showgirl."
story: Taylor Swift was inspired once again by great works of literature while writing several songs on her 12th studio album, "The Life of a Showgirl," which dropped Oct. 3.

The album kicks off with the track "The Fate of Ophelia," which references William Shakespeare's tragic play "Hamlet." Ophelia and Hamlet are young lovers who, because of familial and societal pressures, don't stand a chance together.
TODAY.com is live-blogging all the highlights from the midnight release of “The Life of a Showgirl.” Follow along here for updates.
More ‘Showgirl’ Lyrics
“Elizabeth Taylor”“Opalite”“Father Figure”“Eldest Daughter”“Ruin the Friendship”“Actually Romantic”“Wi$h Li$t”“Wood”“Cancelled!”“Honey”“The Life of a Showgirl,” feat. Sabrina Carpenter

“The Life of a Showgirl,” feat. Sabrina Carpenter
The character of Ophelia is known for her gentle beauty and a passive nature that is ultimately her undoing.

Her "fate" in Hamlet? Well, it's not a cheery one. She exhausts herself trying to please the men in her life while never addressing her own needs. Frustrated by her lack of power — and consumed with grief after Hamlet accidentally kills her father and cruelly breaks off with her — Ophelia goes mad and drowns herself.

But in Swift's take on the story, she's saved from that fate by the subject of the song. In one of the opening lines, she says she "might've drowned in the melancholy" — much like the Shakespearean character. Rather, someone who she "pledges allegiance to" "dug me out of my grave/ And saved my heart from the fate of Ophelia."
The song's subject is seemingly a love interest, with Swift adding in the chorus, "now you’re mine."

“I have this fixation on Shakespeare characters that I love and I can’t stand to see them meet a tragic demise," Swift said on Hits Radio. She said with "The Fate of Ophelia" and her earlier song "Love Story," about "Romeo and Juliet," she tried to flip the script.
In the song, “Someone comes into your life and rescues you from the fate of being driven mad by love," she said on iHeart Radio.
Of note, "The Life of a Showgirl" dropped weeks after Swift got engaged to Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce, whom she started dating in 2023.

Swift directed a music video for "The Fate of Ophelia," which will premiere in theaters Oct. 3. The video will later be available to stream on YouTube starting at 7 p.m. ET on Sunday, Oct. 5 — which will also mark Kelce's 36th birthday.

title: Is 'Psycho' Based on the Life of Ed Gein? Inside the 'Monster' Connection
summary: How is Psycho based on the life of Ed Gein? The new show Monster shows how the two are in converasation.
story: Is one of the most chilling characters in horror movie history based on a real person?

Before there was Norman Bates, the knife-wielding murderer obsessed with his late mother in the seminal 1960 movie "Psycho," there was Ed Gein, a killer whose crimes at his Wisconsin farm were discovered in 1957.

"The Butcher of Plainfield" is the subject of the new Netflix series "Monster: The Ed Gein Story," which starts streaming on Oct. 3. Charlie Hunnam plays Gein, who admitted to murdering two people and was found with numerous objects made from human skin at his Wisconsin farm.
"Psycho" was a groundbreaking film that terrified audiences with its portrayal of a human killer rather than the supernatural ghouls  who previously were the main characters in most horror movies.

"Prior to actually Ed Gein, our relationship with monsters in cinema was Dracula, Frankenstein and werewolves," Charlie Hunnam, who plays Gein in “Monster,” said on TODAY on Sept. 30. "And 'Psycho' was the pivot point where we became the monsters, and that was all of a direct consequence of the influence that Ed Gein had had."
Gein's life has been a catalyst for some of the most legendary horror and suspense movies of all time.

"He was the inspiration for Alfred Hitchcock's 'Psycho,' Buffalo Bill in 'Silence of the Lambs' and 'Texas Chainsaw Massacre,' so he had this huge cultural influence," Hunnam said. "We sort of go back and look at the inspiration behind the inspiration for those films."
Here’s what to know about how Ed Gein’s story played a role in the creation of "Psycho."
Who Was Ed Gein?

Gein was raised with his brother in isolation at a Wisconsin farm in the 1920s and '30s by his domineering and fanatically religious mother,  plus a father who drank heavily and was often violent toward his children.

Gein never married and lived at the family's farm in Plainfield after the death of both of his parents. In 1957, a local deputy found the decapitated body of a local missing woman, Bernice Worden, hanging in a lean-to on the side of his house.

It led to the grisly discovery of preserved human heads, mummified body parts, skulls and items like lampshades and chair seats made out of human skin on Gein's property. He also confessed to killing tavern owner Mary Hogan in 1954 and said he exhumed corpses of women from local graveyards between 1944 and 1952.
Is 'Psycho' Based on Ed Gein?
Legendary director Alfred Hitchcock never explicitly said his 1960 movie starring Anthony Perkins as Norman Bates was based on Gein's life.
However, the movie is based on the 1959 horror novel "Psycho," by writer Robert Bloch. The novel came out two years after Gein's crimes made headlines.
Hitchcock is a character in the Netflix series and is played by "White Lotus" star Tom Hollander, so the connection is part of the story in "Monster."

Block lived 50 miles from Gein’s farmhouse in Wisconsin and based his book on Gein’s story, the Milwaukee Sentinel-Journal reported at the time, according to a 1984 obituary of Gein by The Associated Press.

The obituary also said the movie "Psycho" was "reportedly" based on Gein's story. Gein died at 77 after spending all of his time in Wisconsin mental institutions following his arrest in 1957. Another 1984 obituary by United Press International cited Gein as the inspiration for "Psycho."
How is Norman Bates in 'Psycho' Similar to Ed Gein?
One aspect the two clearly share is an unhealthy obsession with their mothers.
Ed Gein was raised primarily on an isolated farm in Plainfield, Wisconsin, under the thumb of his domineering mother, Augusta Gein.

Gein's fanatically religious mother isolated him from friends at school and drilled into him that women were immoral. Gein never married and became inseparable from his mother, worshipping her and seeking her approval.
A report by Central State Hospital in Wisconsin in 1957 found that Gein, who was 51 at the time, was “inordinately emotionally attached to his mother."

“After the death of his mother, he felt that he had a special power whereby he could raise the dead to life by an act of his will power; and when he found that this was not successful, his emotional needs influenced him to attempt the re-creation of his mother by using the parts of bodies from other graves,” the report states.

In the movie "Psycho," a young man named Norman Bates, played by Anthony Perkins, operates a motel in California with a side hobby as a taxidermist. Perkins makes an appearance as a character in "Monster," played by Joey Pollari.
Similar to Gein's farm in Plainfield, the Bates Motel is located in a remote small town.
The film makes it ambiguous at first whether it's Bates or his mother who has killed a hotel guest and then a detective searching for her at the motel.
In a chilling scene, the sister of a character whom Bates killed discovers the mummified body of Bates' mother in a fruit cellar. Bates then appears in women's clothes and a wig.

The big reveal after Bates is caught is that he killed his mother and then kept her corpse in his home out of guilt. He developed a split personality as Bates and "Mother," often holding a conversation between the two personas.
Much like Gein avoiding relationships with women due to his mother's relentless harping on their immorality, Bates would hear the voice of "Mother" in his head whenever he was attracted to a woman.
In the report by Central State Hospital, Gein told interviewers that he "heard his mother talking to him on several occasions for about a year after she died.”

The theme of dressing up dead women in connection with his mother is mentioned in the report from the Wisconsin hospital. Interviewers describing his grave robbing wrote that "it seems probable that this activity was the result of his desire to re-create the existence of his own mother," although Gein denied it.
Sensationalizing Gein's crimes in popular movies and other creative works over decades is broached on "Monster."

“I think that’s one of the questions we ask on the show is, ‘Who is the monster?’ This boy who did terrible things but had been abused and left in isolation with untreated mental health issues, or this legion of filmmakers that took inspiration from his life and sensationalized for entertainment and arguably darkened the American psyche in the process?” Hunnam said on TODAY.

title: Where Is Former MMA Fighter Mark Kerr, aka 'The Smashing Machine,' Now?
summary: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson transformed into real-life former MMA fighter Mark Kerr for his latest movie “The Smashing Machine.” Here's what to know about Kerr now.
story: Warning: Spoilers for the ending of “The Smashing Machine”
Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson underwent a remarkable transformation for his latest movie “The Smashing Machine,” a film inspired by the real-life of former MMA fighter Mark Kerr.

During a Sept. 30 appearance on “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon,” Johnson shared he had 22 prosthetics and put on just over 30 pounds of muscle to embody Kerr. He also took a moment to give Kerr his flowers.
Johnson explained to Fallon that before the “The Smashing Machine” credits roll, there are title cards (or film intertitles) that include information about the real-life Kerr.
“These fighters today, they make millions of dollars and everyone knows their name,” Johnson, 53, said. “But his name is Mark Kerr.”

“The Smashing Machine” centers on Kerr during 1997 to 2000, focusing on his formative years as a wrestler and his rise to fame. It also chronicled his addiction to painkillers, his subsequent overdose and tumultuous marriage to Dawn Staples-Kerr (portrayed by Emily Blunt).
The film is inspired by the 2002 HBO documentary “The Smashing Machine: The Life and Times of Extreme Fighter Mark Kerr.”

Although considered a pioneer in the MMA and UFC world, Kerr received a different type of fame and attention compared to wrestlers and WWE athletes like Johnson, aka The Rock, who became a household name.
But now, years later, Kerr, 56, is having his own moment in the public eye thanks to thanks to the film named after his UFC stage name, "The Smashing Machine."

Kerr was in attendance when “The Smashing Machine” premiered at the Venice Film Festival. While on the “Tonight Show,” Johnson reflected on sitting alongside Kerr when the crowd erupted in applause after the film ended.

“I was so happy for him, for Mark, because it was his validation that despite your struggles, despite the fact you overdosed twice and you’re still here — he’s lucky to be alive — things turned out OK and you are an inspiration for everybody,” Johnson said. “Mark Kerr is unbelievable.”
Kerr has been promoting the film alongside Johnson, Blunt and director Benny Safdie. During this time, he's also shared more insight into his current life.
What Happened to Mark Kerr?

The film ends with footage of the real-life Kerr grocery shopping in Scottsdale, Arizona. He greets the cashier, loads up his groceries, hops into his truck and departs the parking lot. This moment signals that Kerr appears to have somewhat of a normal life after years of being in the public eye as a wrestler.

As shown in the film, and reflected in his real life, Kerr made his professional MMA debut on Jan. 19. 1997, competing in the heavyweight tournament as part of World Vale Tudo Championship 3. He won three of his matches, securing the tournament title.
He also made his successful UFC debut in July of that year, according to the UFC website. During his time with the UFC, he became a two-time UFC Heavyweight Tournament Champion.
The fighter also competed in multiple MMA promotions including Collision Course, a Japan-based MMA promotion PRIDE Fighting Championships.
He retired from the sport in 2009, UFC notes, and was inducted into the UFC Hall of Fame in June 2025.
During his time as a professional athlete, Kerr was addicted to prescribed painkillers which he used to ease the blows from his fights. He's been open about overdosing due to his addiction.
Where Is Mark Kerr Now?

The former athlete is married to Franci Alberding. The two have a company called Absolute Wellness that promotes well-being whether it's fitness facility design or equipment management, per their website.
He was previously married to Dawn Staples, and their relationship is depicted in "The Smashing Machine." The former couple share a son named Bryce.

He's also been an advocate for mental health, hoping to help those who struggle with addiction. He touched on his advocacy during his speech when he was inducted into the UFC Hall of Fame in July 2025.
Kerr has also been doing interviews ahead of the release of “The Smashing Machine,” talking about seeing Johnson transform into his former self.

“I could still see him in there, but I’m looking at like a mirror picture of myself and it’s this experience where I’m like, ‘Oh my god, man,’” he said during an interview on the “Joe Rogan Experience” podcast. “Like, wow... This is you going to a place that nobody even thought you could get to. It was incredible.”
Kerr also shared how watching one of the final scenes in the film was therapeutic for him.

“It was therapy for me... For the first time, I could actually see my part in it,” he said. “Like, I could see my part, how f------ hard I was on the people around me, how just singularly driven I was to accomplish something at all cost. And the person that paid it the most was Dawn. She paid a heavy price.”
Days before the movie arrived in theaters, Sports Illustrated also released Kerr's joint interview with Johnson looking back at their careers and the film.

“Benny Safdie said this about you,” Johnson told Kerr. “I’m paraphrasing here, but one of the greatest triumphs about our film is the fact that you, yourself, as a human being, as a real man, Mark Kerr, found your own authenticity and finally after all these years, you are comfortable with who you are today.”

title: What Critics Are Saying About Taylor Swift’s ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
summary: Critics are sharing their reviews of Taylor Swfit's highly anticipated album, "The Life of a Showgirl."
story: The reviews are in.

After sending fans into a frenzy back in August with the announcement of a new album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” during an appearance on then-boyfriend and now-fiancé Travis Kelce’s “New Heights” podcast with his brother, Jason, Swift has finally delivered the product, releasing the highly anticipated collection of songs on Oct. 3.
As always, fans are rushing to figure out the deeper meaning in Swift's work, studying the lyrics to understand what she is singing about. Along with fans, the critics are also chiming in.
Below is roundup of what the critics are saying about Swift's new album and their reviews. Scroll below to see how “The Life of a Showgirl” is being received.
Rolling Stone

With “Showgirl,” Maya Georgi with Rolling Stone says Taylor Swift “reached a whole new artistic and personal peak.” At the end of this review, Georgi comments on the album’s final song, the title track featuring Sabrina Carpenter.

“It’s almost as if Swift is passing the torch to the next generation of showgirls as she takes a bow. Could it be her final one? Well, no. This showgirl won’t be left for dead; she’s immortal now. ‘We will see you next time,’ Swift promises as an audience cheers. After all, despite the rock on her finger, Swift is married to the hustle — and with an album as good as this one, she might even try to outdo herself, again. That’s just show business for you.”
Billboard
Billboard's Jason Lipshutz went all in in his review.

"The result is a collection of songs that are immediately engrossing and among the most affecting of Swift’s career, while also focusing on topics like Hamlet and suburban bliss. Call it Bangers for Adults," he wrote.

"For the countless fans who have grown up alongside Swift, 'The Life of a Showgirl' offers a settled, grown-up phase of the love stories that she’s been telling for decades — although the album doesn’t rely on clichés, or go heavy on the cheese."
Variety

"On 'The Life of a Showgirl,' though, love seems easy-fought," Chris Willman wrote in Variety. "And the belief that it might actually be a breeze, instead of, like, the eye of a hurricane, makes for an album that stands as close to being an uncomplicated good time as anything she’s ever done."

"It’s too late for Swift to have a 'song of the summer,' but this feels like the Album of the Summer — the calendar be damned. It’s giddy, funny, touching, silly, haughty and moving in about equal measure, but most of all, it’s got a sunstruck kind of love that besottedly seeps through the orange LP grooves and might even make you believe in romance again, too," he added at the end of the review.
NPR
"For the first time on a recording in a while, Swift is having fun," NPR's Ann Powers wrote. Her voice has never sounded stronger, the collaboration with her studio mates never easier.

"Her lyrics may focus on how her romance with fiancé Travis Kelce brought her back from a fatal heartbreak, but the bangers that are the point of 'The Life of a Showgirl' trumpet another resurrection: Taylor Swift as Western pop’s definitive presence, the star that couldn’t be dimmed," she added.
Los Angeles Times
Mikael Wood did not rave in his review, while comparing Swift's latest effort to her last album, "The Tortured Poets Department."

"As a piece of psychological portraiture, though — the framework, for better or for worse, by which Swift has trained us to interpret her music — this collection of expertly tailored bops falls well short of its predecessor; 'Showgirl' feels like a retreat from the vivid bloodletting of 'Tortured Poets,' which captured a woman whose one-of-one success had emboldened her to speak certain toxic truths," he wrote.
Wood does conceded the album will result in several hits, but laments the lyrical unsophistication.

"There’s no denying that Swift’s lyrics about love here lack the kind of depth she’s mined in tunes thought to have been inspired by the dastardly likes of John Mayer and Matty Healy," he wrote, alluding to a pair of Swift's exes.
The New York Times

"Swift has been pop’s alpha figure for more than a decade, a spot she’s clung to ruthlessly," The New York Times Jon Caramanica wrote in his review. “Showgirl” isn’t precisely a goodbye to all that, but it does cast a wary eye on her past while greeting her future with a glee that verges on the unbridled. It also serves as an implicit capstone to Swift’s career to date."
Caramanica also couldn't help but talk about how "Showgirl" marks Swift's growth since earlier albums.
"A catchy and substantive but unflashy album, it takes the songwriting intimacy of her 'Folklore'/'Evermore' era and renders it with more clarity and oomph," he wrote.

title: What’s On Taylor Swift’s ‘Wi$h Li$t’? Lyrics, Explained
summary: What is "Wish List" about? Unpacking the lyrics to Taylor Swift's "The Life of a Showgirl" track.
story: Even though she is one of the most successful singers in the world, Taylor Swift still has a “Wi$h Li$t.”
On the eighth track of “The Life of a Showgirl,” Swift sings about her big dreams. While other people may want a “yacht life” or an Academy Award, Swift just wants “you.”
Swift, during an interview on iHeart Radio, said the song was the last she wrote for the album and described it as a "very accurate stance on where I'm at in life."
She said on Magic Radio that the song is "really romantic" and "dreamy."
"It details all these things that people aspire to have in their lives. ... then in the chorus it talks about what mine would be," she said.
Swift’s latest album notably comes just weeks after she got engaged to her boyfriend of two years, football star Travis Kelce.

TODAY.com is live-blogging all the highlights from the release of “The Life of a Showgirl.” Follow along here for updates.
When Swift unveiled the album and track list on the “New Heights” podcast in August, the pop icon made sure to emphasize the stylistic choice to have two dollar signs in the song title.
“Just thought I’d point that out, grammatical flourish,” she joked as co-hosts Travis and Jason Kelce laughed.

“Wi$h Li$t” is one of many playful, upbeat songs on the album, a goal for Swift when she left her “Tortured Poets Department” era in the past. In fact, “Wi$h Li$t” could be perceived as a sequel to the “Tortured Poets” track “So High School.”

She worked on the album with Swedish record producers Max Martin and Shellback while finishing the European leg of her “Eras Tour” last year, she revealed on the podcast. Travis Kelce, who had the honor of listening to the album before it arrived Oct. 3, described it as “12 bangers” and “fun pop, excitement.”

Famously a fan of Easter eggs, Swift shared on the podcast that she had secretly hinted to fans that “The Life of a Showgirl” would be a more bright and colorful album during the final moments of the “Eras Tour.”
At the end of her last song, “Karma,” a mysterious, descending orange door appeared on stage.

“I would leave the stage every night going down the elevator lift. That’s how every single ‘Eras’ show ended — except for the last one, where I exited through a door, an orange door, to be specific,” Swift explained on the Aug. 13 episode of “New Heights.”

She continued, “And that actually was an Easter egg. Basically the reason why I chose to exit that way is because I kind of wanted to give a little subliminal hint to the fans that I may be leaving the ‘Era Tour’ era, but I was also entering a new era.”
Swift chooses a different color scheme for each era, and the color orange popped up constantly on her website and social media leading up to the release of “The Life of a Showgirl.”

title: ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ Lyrics: Taylor Swift and Sabrina Carpenter Explore the Price of Stardom
summary: Taylor Swift hints at the price of living life on stage with the title track on her new “The Life of a Showgirl” album, featuring Sabrina Carpenter.
story: Taylor Swift hints at the price of living life on stage with the title track on her new “The Life of a Showgirl” album.

The pop icon’s 12th studio album, out Oct. 3, fittingly includes 12 songs that embrace the theme of navigating a life in the spotlight. For the LP’s outro, Swift teams up with Sabrina Carpenter for “The Life of a Showgirl.”

The song, which is one of the longest on the album at just over four minutes, marks the first collaboration between Swift and Carpenter. The two have been friends for years, with Carpenter’s music career skyrocketing after opening for Swift on the “Eras Tour.”
More ‘Showgirl’ Lyrics
